meanings.definition: Move or cause to move rapidly to and fro.
meanings.sent1: The dog was wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: She saw the flag wagging in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The wind was wagging the tree branches vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The metronome kept wagging back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum was wagging steadily in the clock.

meanings.definition: Move or cause to move in a playful or teasing manner.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was wagging its tail playfully.
meanings.sent2: He was wagging his finger at her in a teasing way.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was wagging the toy in front of the cat.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was wagging its tail as if mocking the bird.
meanings.sent5: The jester was wagging his hat around to entertain the crowd.
